bug.author: resposit
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
It seems there's a situation where a multiselect widget loses its selected values. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Consider the following app: <denchmark-code>ab = ['a','b'] cb = st.checkbox('cb',value=True,key='cb') if not cb: ms1 = st.multiselect('ms1',ab,default=ab,key='ms1') ms2 = st.multiselect('ms2',ab,default=ab,key='ms2') </denchmark-code>
Click on 'b' in ms2 (this will select only 'a') Click on the checkbox (this will display ms1 before ms2)
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I would expect ms2 displaying only 'a' as preselected value. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
ms2 displays 'a' and 'b' as it was rendered for the first time <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
don't know <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.54.0 Python version: 3.6.8

comments.comment:
Apparently, if I use a placeholder for ms1 I get the expectect behavior: <denchmark-code>cb = st.checkbox('cb',value=True,key='cb') eb = st.empty() if not cb: ms1 = eb.multiselect('ms1',ab,default=ab,key='ms1') ms2 = st.multiselect('ms2',ab,default=ab,key='ms2') </denchmark-code>
I don't quite understand the difference...
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/resposit>@resposit</denchmark-link> , Thanks for catching this! , this is an actual bug and we are going to be fixing this as soon as possible.
